sentences.en: ‘Fun, was it? Well, you could have fooled me!’.
sentences.cn: “有趣，是吗？得了，别骗我啦！”。

sentences.en: "I'm not altogether a fool," she said gruffly.
sentences.cn: “我还不太傻，”她生硬地说。

sentences.en: Don’t pay any attention to Henry. He’s just fooling.
sentences.cn: 别理会亨利，他只是闹着玩的。

sentences.en: Even art experts were fooled.
sentences.cn: 连艺术品专家也被骗了。

sentences.en: fooled away the week's pay on Friday night.
sentences.cn: 周五晚上花掉了整个星期的工资

sentences.en: He has simply been exposed as an adulterer and a fool.
sentences.cn: 有人揭发他就是个奸夫和白痴。

sentences.en: He kept telling her that here you did not fool with officials.
sentences.cn: 他一直在告诫她这里的官员不好糊弄。

sentences.en: He thought he could fool people with transparent deceptions.
sentences.cn: 他以为他能用那些可以一眼看穿的鬼把戏愚弄人。

sentences.en: He was able to fool the world with his veneer of education.
sentences.cn: 他打着受过良好教育的幌子到处欺瞒世人。

sentences.en: He was drinking and making a fool of himself.
sentences.cn: 他在喝酒，让自己出尽了丑。

sentences.en: He'd been a fool to get involved with her!
sentences.cn: 他竟然跟她扯到了一起，真是傻瓜！

sentences.en: I suddenly realised that I was being made a fool of.
sentences.cn: 我突然明白过来，我被人耍了。

sentences.en: I was a fool to have let her talk me into it.
sentences.cn: 我真笨，竟然听从了她的劝说。

sentences.en: I'd been a fool letting him snow me with his big ideas.
sentences.cn: 我真蠢，居然被他的胡乱吹嘘给蒙蔽了。

sentences.en: if suckers will actually pay to do the work, more fool them.
sentences.cn: 如果有笨蛋愿花钱做那种事，那真是傻透了！。

sentences.en: Like a fool, I accepted straight away.
sentences.cn: 我像个傻子，立刻就接受了。

sentences.en: Most managers couldn't care less about information technology. More fool them.
sentences.cn: 多数的经理管理者根本不关心信息技术，他们真的很傻。

sentences.en: People always think I'm a fool, and I dare say they're right.
sentences.cn: 人们总认为我是个傻瓜，想必他们是对的。

sentences.en: The man was a fool, he thought, or at least incompetent.
sentences.cn: 他想道，那人是个傻瓜，或者说，至少很无能。

sentences.en: They tried to fool you into coming after us.
sentences.cn: 他们想要骗你来追踪我们。

sentences.en: was fooling around with some figures in hopes of balancing the budget.
sentences.cn: 懒散地算着数字，希望能平衡开支

sentences.en: What a damn fool thing to do!
sentences.cn: 这样做真是愚蠢得要死！

sentences.en: What a fool she had been to think that he would stay.
sentences.cn: 她竟然那么傻，以为他会留下来。

sentences.en: What did you say a fool thing like that for?
sentences.cn: 你为什么要说那种蠢话？

sentences.en: You poor deluded fool!
sentences.cn: 你这个上当受骗的傻瓜！

sentences.en: You silly old fool !
sentences.cn: 你这个大傻瓜！

sentences.en: Your brother is making a fool of you.
sentences.cn: 你哥哥在戏弄你。

phrases.phrase: a fool and his money are soon parted

phrases.tran_cn: 愚人节；愚人节中受愚弄者
闲荡；游手好闲；干无用的事
滥交：从事随意，常是乱搞性行为
与不三不四的人鬼混（等于fool about with）
愚蠢地浪费（时间或钱）；挥霍

phrases.phrase: fools rush in where angels fear to tread
phrases.tran_cn: (谚)智者三思之事蠢人急不可待
聪明人；绝不是傻瓜；精明机敏
扮丑角，逗人笑；做傻瓜，干蠢事

phrases.phrase: play the fool 或 act the fool
phrases.tran_cn: 以滑稽，玩笑的方式行动

phrases.phrase: there's no fool like an old fool

phrases.tran_cn: 你别骗我啦！（对别人说法表示嘲讽或怀疑）

trans.tran_en: a stupid person or someone who has done something stupid
a stupid person or someone who has done something stupid
to trick someone into believing something that is not true
to trick someone into believing something that is not true
